decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by consistently countering key spells and removing threats from the board. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils help generate card advantage and provide additional control options. The deck also utilizes versatile cards like Isochron Scepter and Prismatic Ending to deal with a variety of threats. By maintaining a strong control over the game, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize various counter spells, card draw, and tutor effects to quickly assemble the Goblin Charbelcher combo win condition. By using mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Bloom and Hydroelectric Specimen, the deck aims to cast Goblin Charbelcher and activate its ability to deal lethal damage to the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes disruption spells like Disrupting Shoal and Jwari Disruption to protect the combo and control the game until the win condition can be achieved.

The deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures and ramp spells to quickly gain mana advantage and control the board, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with removal spells. The goal is to ramp up to powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker to dominate the late game. The deck also utilizes land destruction with cards like Ghost Quarter and Kozilek's Return to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through efficient resource management and strategic plays.

This deck revolves around casting a large number of spells quickly to generate mana and storm count, ultimately leading to a win condition with cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot. By utilizing rituals and card draw spells, the goal is to build up a critical mass of spells to overwhelm the opponent in a single explosive turn. The deck also includes elements of card selection and filtering to help find key pieces of the combo. Overall, the deck focuses on efficient mana generation, card advantage, and high spell density to achieve a powerful combo finish.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury while utilizing burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board. The deck also includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Thraben Charm for additional support and disruption. The mana base is streamlined with fetch lands like Arid Mesa and Flooded Strand to ensure consistent colors, and sideboard options like Blood Moon and Elegant Parlor provide additional versatility and disruption against different types of decks.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence using powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck also includes several direct damage spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to help finish off opponents quickly. Various support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Arena of Glory provide additional benefits and protection for the creatures. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of fast, evasive creatures and burn spells, while also disrupting their strategy with cards like Static Prison and Thraben Charm.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. It also utilizes cards like Solitude and Faithful Mending for control and card advantage. Atraxa, Grand Unifier helps to protect the combo by providing counterspells and protection. The deck aims to win through a quick and explosive combo, overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats that are difficult to deal with. Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Negation are used to disrupt the opponent's game plan and ensure the combo goes off smoothly.

This deck focuses on generating mana quickly with rituals and mana generators to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames. It also utilizes card draw and selection to find combo pieces efficiently. The goal is to create a storm of spells to overwhelm the opponent, using cards like Glimpse the Impossible and Reckless Impulse to keep the combo going. The deck also includes alternate win conditions with Wish and Artist's Talent. The inclusion of Valakut Awakening helps with card selection and potential graveyard recursion.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the board, as well as cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate for additional value, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and overwhelm them with a mix of disruptive creatures and efficient removal spells. The deck's key strategy is to leverage its disruptive elements to maintain control of the game while applying pressure through aggressive creatures to secure victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays using a combination of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer, along with burn spells such as Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. The key strategy is to quickly deploy threats and apply pressure on the opponent while utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment and Ocelot Pride to deal additional damage. The inclusion of Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker adds resilience and card advantage to the deck. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provide additional firepower and disruption to help secure victories in a fast-paced Modern format.

This deck focuses on aggressive plays by utilizing a mix of creatures and direct damage spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help control the board while Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu provide early pressure. Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Scion of Draco offer additional win conditions. The deck also includes a small countermagic package with Stubborn Denial to protect its threats. Overall, the key strategy is to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain control of the board to secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on mana ramp and control through the use of Eldrazi creatures and powerful spells. By accelerating mana production with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple, the deck aims to cast big threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Thought-Knot Seer early in the game. The deck also includes disruption spells like Dress Down and Kozilek's Command to control the opponent's game plan. With a mix of powerful threats and control elements, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its Eldrazi creatures while disrupting their strategy.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures while disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. The creatures in the deck have powerful abilities that can give you an advantage in the game, while cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp provide additional value by blinking them. The mana base is designed to make sure you have access to all your colors while also being able to search for specific lands with Flooded Strand and Marsh Flats. Overall, this deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their strategy to come out ahead in the game.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents by using cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Teferi, Time Raveler, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate. It aims to control the board with cards like Fatal Push and Solitude, while also generating value with creatures that have beneficial enters-the-battlefield effects. Additionally, the deck utilizes a mix of taxing effects and powerful creatures to disrupt opponents' game plans and win through efficient aggression and incremental advantage.

Utilizing the powerful UrzaTron lands to ramp up quickly, this Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while steadily building towards big threats like Eldrazi and Planeswalkers. With access to a variety of removal spells and disruptive artifacts, the deck aims to control the board and out-value opponents with powerful threats like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn, the Great Creator. By combining efficient removal, card advantage, and powerful finishers, this deck aims to maintain control of the game and overpower opponents in the late game.

The deck focuses on utilizing the combo and reanimation mechanics to bring powerful creatures back from the graveyard. It includes cards like Archon of Cruelty and Emperor of Bones, along with spells like Persist and Ephemerate to facilitate this strategy. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board and protect its creatures. The mana base consists of various fetch lands and shock lands to ensure consistent mana fixing. Overall, the deck aims to quickly bring back strong creatures from the graveyard to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.
